newsitem.title: USA: FOMC opens meeting on interest-rate policy.
newsitem.headline: FOMC opens meeting on interest-rate policy.

text.p: Federal Reserve policy-makers began meeting on Tuesday to consider whether to raise interest rates for the first time in about 1-1/2 years.
Fed spokesman Joseph Coyne said the Federal Open Market Committee meeting opened as scheduled at 9 a.m. EDT/1300 GMT. An announcement of its outcome is expected about 2:15 p.m. /1815.

A thin majority of economists surveyed by Reuters on Monday said they expected the U.S. central bank to decide to bump up short-term rates by a quarter percentage point, the first such increase since February 1995, to keep potential inflation pressures in check.
